bibl.title: Letter from Federico Gomez to George A. Kellogg, March 10, 1941

div1.p: Gomez requests information that he can use to show the Cuban government the part that Wyeth Company is playing in publicizing Finlay's work.

VIA AIR MAIL
Copy
BESTOV PRODUCTS, S. A.
Apartado No. 550
MARIANAO - HABANA
Ref. No. 17
March 10th, 1941
Mr. George Kellogg
c/o Kolynos Co., Export Agents
John Wyeth & Bro., Inc.,
Jersey City, N.J.
Dear Mr. Kellogg:
div1.p:
The “Federación Médica de Cuba” and the “Sociedad de Estudios
Clínicos de La Habana”, the two outstanding medical societies
here, are trying to get official support from the Cuban govern-
ment to make Dr. Finlay's work on yellow fever known throughout
the world. They will present a memorandum to the Cuban Senate
stating the importance of their campaign and they hope President
Batista will assign money to have Dr. E. Domínguez' book on
Finlay's work translated to every language for free distribution.

Dr. Fernando Milanés suggested that I obtain from you a letter
stating all the sources you studied to decide on sponsoring the
painting the “Conquest of Yellow Fever”. They want to present
this letter as a testimoney to Congress of the part an American
frim has taken to make Finlay's work known and at the same time
get their cooperation, as Cubans, in their work.

As you will see, this will get some publicity for Wyeth and at the
same time will be an introduction in the official records of the
part you are doing in the Finlay's campaign. I hope you will be
able to send me such a statement of facts this same week.
div1.closer:
(signed) F i c o
Federico Gómez.
Cuban representative
for John Wyeth & Bro.,
